text: Tap at GABF. Pours a clear yellow gold with medium white head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is funk, oak, lemon, apple. Medium body, wood, funk, lemon, nice tartness, very good.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2015 Draft pour at the Pine Box. Pours a clear copper color with very little head. I love the beers with a small story to it.  Reading that this was aged for about 800 days. Crazy! I hadnt even started drinking beer when this was in the barrel aging.  Definitely makes this beer unique to me. Flavor has a sour green apple like flavor with a heavy lingering sour taste. Really nice sour.  Enjoyed this.

Pale golden color. Tart, lactic-funky aroma. Quite tart in flavor; leomny-delicious.

Notes: GABF 13

Fobab 2013 Rate #4: 
Pours a pale gold, and actually has a nice head to it. 

The aroma is funky and barnyardy. Its got a bit of sour fruit and oak in the nose. 

The flavor is dry and tart with a good dosing of lemony character and general sour fruit. Its got a nice white grape character and some earthy & oaky tones.
Cloudy yellow. Cool beer! Yogurt, lemons, dank earth, wet wood, light tannic notes, oak, vanilla from the oak I am guessing...cool as shit!

Sampled at Perennials Midwest Belgian Beer Festival - Pours lightly hazy yellow / golden. the aroma is sour with lacto and citrus along with mild toast to the malt and some funkiness. It has a medium smooth body that has just a bit of light soft carbonation. The flavor starts with smooth sourness, lacto/milk smoothness and light vinegar. The finish adds lemon and creaminess. Excellent.

GABF 2013. Pours a hazy golden yellow appearance with a white head. Holy shit, this mofo has a bunch of funky cheese, cobweb, and basement aromas. Lemon, lactic, vanilla, hay, straw, wheat, moderately sour flavor with a bit dry finish. Fucken cool beer. You cant fake the funk, bro.

Sampled at GABF 2013. Pours a hazy gold with lots of white head. Musty nose, some wood, grass, pithy, lots of acid. Flavor is very acetic, grass, pithy, vitamin C tablets. Acetic finish. Too much acid.
On tap at GABF 2013, big lemon yeasty funk and the taste is super puckering tart, nice!

Sampled at GABF 2013. Pours hazy golden with a medium white head. Aroma of tart fruit, barnyard, horse blanket and citrus. Flavour is light sweet and heavy acidic. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Sample @ GABF 13. Pours a clear golden beer with a small white head on top. Aroma is tart, Brett, cherries and other fruits. Flavour is very sour and dry, big oak barrel characters in there. Long dry tart finish. Nice brew.
Draft. Pours cloudy yellow gold. Nose and taste of vinegar, red wine, oak and wild yeast. Medium body. Very sour.
Sampled at Midwest Belgian Beer Festival. Pours a hazy golden color with white head. Very sour, tart, lemon, vinegar flavors. Fun to try.
Sour. Decent. Maybe Im starting to like sours. Refreshing. Thin white head. Midwest Belgian beer festival at Perennial.
On tap at Green Lady.  Quite sour and moderately acetic. Similar to a lot of Lost Abbey blonde sours.
Tap sample @ Midwest SourWildFunkFest. Funky tart lactic aroma. Hay straw gold with a small white head. Tart fruity lactic, vanilla, smooth oaky flavor.  Light body, soft carbonation.
Didnt get the same diacetyl issues as others but will say this is a funk bomb and doesnt have much sourness.

On tap at Brasserie - Pours clear amber with a thin white head. Nose is yogurty, tart vinegar--sour, but not too complex. Taste is pretty aggressive tartness, sharp and vinegary with lemon and citrus rind. Soft body with nice fluffy carbonation.

FoBAB 2011. This one was a bit hyped and then, not sure why this flopped. Tart aroma.  Funky odd I think theres a little microwave popcorn there. Diacetel city flavors. Tart fruits lactic with lots of Diacetel. Insane amounts. 4/3/3/2/5
FoBAB 11. Pours a clean light yellowish brown with fizzy white head. Nose & taste are of funk, vinegar, lemon, & flowers. Very nice beer.

Tasted on draft at FoBAB 2011.  Pours clear, pale copper with an average white head that leaves a thin collar of lace.  The nose is tart and sour with lemon peel, white wine vinegar, and just a touch of vanilla.  The flavor is bitingly acidic with some bread malt, lemon, white wine vinegar, and barnyard funk.  The body is light and tannic with average carbonation and a long, sour and acidic finish.

Thanks for the growler, Adam.  Pours a clear orange color with minimal head or carbonation.  A really nice funk to the aroma.  Theres some earthy musty notes to it and a bit of lemon peel and green apple.  The flavor isnt quite as good.  Its a touch vinegary.  Theres a little malt sweetness to it as well.  A bit of lemon peel, maybe a little Smarties.  Medium bodies with low carbonation.

FoBAB 9. Hazy gold, large bubbled white head. Nose is extreme aceto with the sulfer notes from Lambicus, green and spicy despite light dough. Flavor is ultra sour, eggy citric, harsh, light acetic qualities growing through mid, very thin and oily. As close to Lambicus as Ive seen, more juicy and Santa-Fe like. Hate these kinds of beers, oddly enough very few Belgian unblendeds are extreme like this.

On tap at Fobab 9. Pours clear pale golden with white head. Aromas of funk, horse blanket, and some tartness. Flavor is horse blanket, funk, bit of a fruit note, buttery, and decent amount of tartness. Little disappointing.

Sampled from the tap at 2011 FOBAB. Poured a near clear gold with a slight amber hue and a white head that lasted throughout the beer. Aroma had a good amount of funk and a surprisingly sweet note of tropical/light fruits. Flavor had a good amount of acid that cut the sweetness with some dry wine and funk that finished out the beer. After taste was a bit odd, but cannot put my tongue on it.

Draft at FoBAB 9. Pours a mostly clear deep golden. Nose is decent, touch vegetal, big barnyard funk and a certain freshness to it as well. Not perfect, but charming. Tartness and some cherry notes are pulled out of the nose but the vegetal is a bit distracting. On tasting, crisp acidity, more of that kind of vegetal note. Dry finish, quite bready. Would love to try again and will give another fair shot. Not perfect.

A hazed amber lambic with a thin off white head. In aroma, a beautiful lambic with sour cherries,light buttery notes, Epsom slats, horseblanket. In mouth, a smooth lambic with nice acidity, vinegar points, light buttery notes, nice and smooth. On tap at FoBAB 2011.

Excited to try this, as the early ratings indicated promise. This sample had problems.  Buttery, rotten fruit.    Vegetal.   Dirty pond water funk.   Some rotten yogurt sourness.   Not very enjoyable.   Witnessed kan drink this later in the day and note that it was a completely diffeent animal than the awesome beer he tried on a prior occasion.  Not sure what happened with this sample.

had this on a couple occasions. first time was directly out of the keg thanks to the headbrewer and then this second time, thanks to a partial growler fill courtesy of adam.... pours a hazy and muted dark red grapefruit reddish pink hue and topped with a minimal layer of soapy white head.  sightly transparent in nature allowing some light to pass through. some small floaties are also suspended within the liquid... aroma is sharp and acetic , almost bracingly so but stops just short, with notes of strawberries and sour lemon juice. subtler notes of vanilla and oak come through late... flavors compliment the aroma with a burst of sourness coming through first but then mellows out offering a touch of mild sweetness. red fruits and berry sourness for the duration leaving a light sour acetic burn as it goes down.  light to medium bodied with adequate carbonation throughout.  softer grains and oak come through late. solid american sour thats for sure.  id certainly search this one out again.

Two drafts served in a goblet at Destihl in Normal.

Murky orange, hazy with particulate matter (fruit skin, barrel residue, who knows). Thin ring of white foam at the edge, no lacing, a thin broken skim across the surface. 

Fruity citrus and yogurt aromas, some wet hay as it warms, lactic tartness and fruity acidity. Soft and pleasant, straightforward though not especially funky or nuanced. Fruit forward with orange, lemon, and green strawberry notes.

Puckering acetic acid at first, fruity lemon and citrus flavors, residual brett aftertaste. Clean lactic finish that practically vanishes without a trace. Well carbonated, effervescent and light bodied. Lacks a little bit in the complexity department, but otherwise tasty. Definitely quenching and drinkable. Very reminiscent of Uplands lambic output, possibly due a similar inoculation of lacto and brett. Also comparable to an unfruited version of Destihls Sour Strawberry.

Snifter pour on tap at the brewpub (Normal, IL). Pours a hazy dulled golden hue, lively carbonation with a frothy bubbly brighter white head that dies to a film, laces ok. Aromas are heavenly, preaching a lively dose of lactic acid, lemons and hay, funky straw, touch of cheesiness. Some more oak, gentle barrel mixes into a healthy sourness, sweet tarts, healthy straw, flaked wheat, touches of nuance and funk behind that Destihl blonde sour feel. Initial is medium bodied, offering a healthy fruity quality, some esters mix with a healthy lactic acidity, lemons and apples, crab apples, flaked wheat, gives it a touch of girth in the body. Middle showing lively fruit and sourness, moving into some yogurt and more lemons, getting a lot more yogurty into the finish, crisp and sour, lingering with some oaky qualities. Finish lingers of lactic acid, lemons, fruity crab apple, touches of pear, straw, drying out. Overall, acidity isnt overpowering, but is firm. Really nice, not thinned out, offering a touch of body and great wild yeast character, healthy sourness. Really enjoyed this, over three years in the making, with a solid sourness that doesnt eclipse the solid sturdy funkiness years in the making, and doesnt thin out the body. Top notch beer.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2011 draft... an outstanding unblended spontaneously fermented lambic in red wine barrels.... might be the best American sour Ive had, smells outstanding, tart, lactic, sweet, red wine oak, taste is more of the nose, wonderful sweet fruit note that you cant get enough of
